guide.title: Gentoo on the PowerPC
guide.subtitle: Main Page
guide.abstract: The Gentoo on PowerPC project focuses on porting the Gentoo experience to the ppc 32-bit and 64-bit platforms.

ti.i: Posted on Aug 6, 2003 by Pieter Van den Abeele

ti.p: Just a quick note: PPC documentation is now updated for 1.4_final and includes GRP instructions

ti.i: Posted on Aug 6, 2003 by Pieter Van den Abeele

ti.p: The 2.6 version of SELinux is no longer platform-specific, as all of the arch-specific code has been removed (2.4 SELinux only worked on x86 and arm. Chris Pebenito will be working on getting SELinux up and running on PPC.
The 2.6 kernel is already running on PPC and most of the core userland stuff has been build. Expect a LiveCD showcasing this technology on PowerPC real soon. Info on Gentoo/SELinux can be found here

ti.i: Posted on July 21, 2003 by Pieter Van den Abeele

ti.p: Heya, if you're reading this that means you've found the new Gentoo for PowerPC page. The purpose of this page is to provide ppc users with fine grained usefull information about Gentoo/PPC. This page will be updated on a regular basis. All information regarding gentoo on powerpc or its subprojects will eventually be availabe from this page or pages linked from this page.

Gentoo/PPC 1.4 was released on Linux World Expo featuring some unique collector-grade art. Two disc GRP sets for generic PPC, G3 and G4 powered machines, a new KDE/GNOME livecd and a 70M small iso are available from the Gentoo mirrors.
Gentoo on the PowerPC G5 will be available after the 1.4 release, but an exact release date isn't set yet.

As Gentoo moves to a non-profit and well-structured organization, PPC also needs to get organized. We're currently in the process of doing that. Subprojects will be announced on this page, each with their own homepage.
If you're interested in helping out the ppc-team, don't hesitate contacting us using ppc@gentoo.org or any of the ppc mailinglists.
